Amounts from the Fund shall be used to supplement and not supplant other Federal, State, regional,

header.#text: National Data Repository for Marine Diseases Research and Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a National Data Repository for Marine Diseases Research and Services.
			 Subject to the availability of appropriations, the

shall enter
			 into a contract with an entity eligible under subsection (c) to develop
			 and administer such repository.

text.#text: The
The purpose of the Data Repository shall be to—

collect, store, and disseminate information regarding research, data, findings, and technical
			 assistance materials related to marine diseases;

facilitate the development, coordination, and rapid dissemination of research on marine diseases;
			 and

collect epidemiological, environmental impact, timeline, global positioning system registered
			 location, and ecological consequence data regarding marine diseases,
			 linking different datasets across the country to assist researchers in
			 developing strategies for addressing marine diseases.
To be eligible for the contract under subsection (a), an entity shall—
be a public or private nonprofit entity;
have experience—
collecting data;
developing systems to store data in a secure manner;
developing Internet web portals and other means of communicating with a wide audience; and
making information available to the public; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers appropriate.

text.#text: meet such other criteria as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . The Director, in consultation with the
and
, shall—

text.#text:
As a condition of receiving the contract under subsection (a), an entity shall agree to employ a
			 director of the Data Repository chosen in accordance with guidance issued
			 by the

collect information and research methodologies from individuals, agencies, and organizations
			 engaged in the research of marine diseases;

ensure research methods are standardized whenever possible to ensure data comparability across
			 regions;
securely store and maintain information in the Data Repository;

make information in the Data Repository accessible through an Internet website or other appropriate
			 means of sharing information; and

ensure that the information contained in the Data Repository is accessible to members of the
			 public, marine disease researchers, and persons responding to marine
			 disease emergencies.
